caption:
This photograph features a modest, slightly weathered rural store with a primary function as a feed and trucking business, named "Woodside Feed & Trucking." The structure appears to be a single-story building with a flat front and side overhangs supported by simple pillars, typical of small roadside businesses.

The front of the store is adorned with various signs advertising brands such as "Wayne Feeds," "Funk's G Hybrid," and beverage brands like "Pepsi." The signs contribute to a colorful yet cluttered visual, suggesting the store serves multi-purpose roles possibly catering not only to agricultural needs but also providing conveniences like soft drinks.

A single, old-fashioned gasoline pump stands in front, labeled with the Shell brand, indicating the store also functions as a refueling station. The pump adds a nostalgic element to the scene, indicative of earlier decades.

The facade of the building has large windows which allow a glimpse into the interior where products are likely displayed. Around the building, the ground is largely unpaved with patches of grass, and the background shows lush greenery hinting at a rural setting.

Overall, the photograph captures a snapshot of a functional community hub in a countryside location, evoking a sense of rustic charm and the simplicity of rural commercial operations. The store serves as a poignant representation of small-town commerce, integral to its local community.
title: Du Quoin gas station
